message:
Microsoft #VisualStudio in the browser? Yes, for real, look for the word "Monaco":

http://www.visualstudio.com/en-us/news/2013-nov-13-vso
caption: Attachment UnavailableThis attachment may have been removed or the person who shared it may not have permission to share it with you.

data.message: That will actually make .NET development a revolution :D i would love to be able to use .NET on MAC or Linux Now I can (I think so)

Mono has enabled that for ages, and it gets better with time and Xamarin's reliance on it (because Xamarin is commercial, it is able to push money into Mono, as it relies on it). But it's surely a revolution for Microsoft.
I'm guessing Scott Guthrie is hero behind all of this, just as he is the hero behind making Azure a good offering instead of crap.
Is there an "Unlike" or "Hate" button that I can use for Visual Studio in the cloud?
No, for obvious reasons about not favoring people spreading negativity. However, your comment conveys the meaning.
I meant as a joke about that I don't like having Visual Studio in the cloud. Not actually asking for a dislike button.
I see what you mean. Well, web based IDEs are not new at all, and as discuss this is quite revolutionary for Microsoft. I don't think they'll be on it too much.

It may be one of those features that'll exist half baked just to tick the box in a todo-list called "what cool kidz say they don't use us because we don't have it". It may be a good offering too. Until someone gets a proper first hand experience, I don't think an educated opinion can be made.
That said, you know, no one size fits all.
These kind of online IDE have very narrow use cases.

This was created to help SharePoint developers whom want to create apps for Office 365 to use SharePoint 2013 client model on the cloud, it's not new check this http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/office/jj220038.aspx
.NET team is working to help Microsoft products so they built this for SharePoint not to make Visual Studio on cloud.
